content.description: Start by reaching high to the obvious hueco on the face. Get feet and then throw up and right to a jug. Top it out!
content.location: The approach trail to Lunch Rocks leads directly to this climb. Look for a deep fist sized hueco 8 feet up on the face.

content.description: This is the obvious sit start to Wonderhole. Sit start matched on the rail down and right of the hole, with one heck of a greasy foot. Make one huge throw to the large hueco and top out.
content.location: This is in the Lunch Rocks area. It is the boulder with the obvious large hueco in the middle of its face.

content.description: Not clear if it starts high on the jugs, or if you're supposed to start lower. Seems fairly committing.
content.location: On the front side of Browntown Rock, facing the road. Might have to bushwack a little to get to it. Just to the right of the Dripping Gash.

content.description: Decent route, chossy rock up high
content.location: to the left of Hard Again(the chalked up arete)

content.description: Start on any part of the huge undercling hueco, likely with left foot low and right in the bottom of the hueco. Go big, slam dunk. Match, trend a bit right and then up.
content.protection: One or Two pads will do. Throw is a bit wild..
content.location: From Wonderhole, walk down a bit toward Nachoman. This boulder has a huge obvious undercling hueco on the left side and a very polish face.

content.description: fun problem, starts in bomber undercling, climb through slopers to good holds
content.location: on the opposite side of orifice affair, scramble up boulder, to the far right if facing the boulder

content.description:
**Effective December 2014 this climb is closed**

  This stellar problem doesn't have any super difficult moves, but every move is solid with a consistent difficulty until the top.   Begin on a good left facing sidepull and climb left through a decent pinch to a small undercling.  From here make a big move to a good crimp, match and make a committing move to a jug.  This gives a chance for a shake as while from here things ease up, it will keep you on your toes until the top. 

  Probably on the easier side of V7, but the excitement of a possible fall makes up for it.
content.protection:
The more pads and spotters the better.  The landing area is pretty uneven at the start and the finish is pretty high above an annoyingly placed boulder and tree. 

  As Sherman eloquently writes "Tempting bad landings below the first moves and a melon-splitting block behind the lip.  Terrifying, technical."
content.location: Located in the Lunch Rocks area, with careful spotting, Roughage should be visible from the trail.  It is located on the level above The Wonder Dyno and Chong Li.

content.description: Sit start and climb the line of hueco's.  Beware some aren't quite as good as they look.
content.location: Located on Brownstone Rock this is the obvious line of hueco's that begs to be climbed.  From the trail that leads to the area, head right for 20ft into a small corridor.

content.description: Sit Start on good jug down and right of the Wonderhole.  Make a big move right to an ok crimp and figure out how to heel the starting holds.  From here pull the harder than it looks low angle topout.
content.location: Right side of the main lunch rocks area.  Starts just below the obvious Hueco that is the Wonderhole.

content.description: Climb the left side of the blunt arete.  The first move is tricky, an off balance throw, then it eases up.  The finish is kinda high but the holds are positive.
content.protection: Several pads as the finish is kinda high.
content.location: Located on the Brownstone boulder,  It is the obvious arete visible from the trail,  If you reach the pockets of Orifice Affair you've gone a little too far around the boulder.

content.description: Good landing, gets thin up high, but it's all there. Fun slab problem!
content.location: On the frontside of Browntown Rock, facing the road. Might have to bushwack a little to get to it. Seems to start on a righthand hueco and a thigh-high foot ledge, goes up through a dripping gash.

content.description: Start sitting with sidepull slopers. Compress to a left crimp then make hard moves to a crimpy crack. Finish on jugs.

Start with a good right hand pocket and a bad 2-finger left hand pocket. Put your left toe next to your shoulder and figure out how to lock off to the next set of shallow pockets. Once matched, the top out is casual.
content.location: Far left side of the boulder with the wonder hole, to the left of the bush.

content.description:
Start sitting on the left side of the boulder just right of the slab. Start in a good horizontal seam and make a challenging move up to a crimp. Keep it together and move slightly left to a gaston then to the topout.

  Also this climb is listed as V2 in the John Sherman guide, unsure if this is a mis-print or if something broke.
content.location: On the Present Arms Boulder. From Orifice Affair continue through the corridor and under Scarface rock. Also easy to approach from the road, pass by an old cement slab and continue to the left side of the boulder.  The right side is off limits due to Rock Art.  Note that the picture is incorrect in the Wilder guide, it has "How Cilley Can You Get" and "Another Day, Another Dollar" transposed.

content.description: Start by stemming from the rock perch onto the wall via diagonal crack/reail. Harder for short people (might have to jump)? Follow the pumpy crack/rail to the top. The crux is near the top.
content.protection: 7 foot slings for the natural - #2.5 - #3 Cam for the directional. Easy 3rd class top access.
content.location: Located near the now closed Thing Fish boulder problem.

content.description: This area contains several different boulders: Turtle Wax Stone, Brownstone Rock, Lunch Rocks, Scarface Rock, and Present Arms Boulder.  The area contains many quality easy routes in the V0-V2 rainge, a few V3's and a high concentration of V7's.  Things top out with the Wonder Dyno at V10.
